Line 18: Line 18:
==Biography==
==Biography==
===Background===
===Background===
â
Nady was born on December 31, 1981 into a family of artists. His father, Mohammad Nady, was a cartoonist and his mother, Iman Ezzat, is a sculptor and writer.<ref name="ahram1">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/News/18633.aspx |title=Ahmad Nady: A budding Egyptian cartoonist - Arts & Culture - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-09-21}}</ref> In addition to his parents, Nady has cited his childhood and upbringing in the 10th of Ramadan City<ref group=note>The "10th of Ramadan City" is like the [[6th of October City]].</ref> as an early influence in becoming an artist. As a child, he was an avid reader of comic books and magazines and he would occasionally create comics about his relatives, basing his characters on their features.
+
Nady was born on December 31, 1981 into a family of artists. His father, Mohammad Nady, was a cartoonist and his mother, Iman Ezzat, is a sculptor and writer.<ref name="ahram1">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/News/18633.aspx |title=Ahmad Nady: A budding Egyptian cartoonist - Arts & Culture - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date=2011-08-12 |accessdate=2011-09-21}}</ref> In addition to his parents, Nady has cited his childhood and upbringing in the 10th of Ramadan City<ref group=note>The "10th of Ramadan City" is like the [[6th of October City]].</ref> as an early influence in becoming an artist. As a child, he was an avid reader of comic books and magazines and he would occasionally create comics about his relatives, basing his characters on their features.
â
Over time, this became a hobby with his father acting as mentor. He drew caricatures of schoolmates and teachers. Among his first comic characters was the "Amazing Mido" ({{lang-ar|ÙÙØ¯Ù Ø§ÙØ¹Ø¬ÙØ¨}} ''Mido al-'Ajeeb''), a young inventor who was subjected to radiation that allowed him to easily control and change his shape and form.<ref name="mawhopon">[http://www.mawhopon.net/ver_ar/news.php?news_id=4832 Ahmed Nady: One of the most famous comics artists in Egypt]</ref><ref name="youm7">[http://www.youm7.com/News.asp?NewsID=172483 Pharaohs were the first discovered the art of Comics]</ref>
+
Over time, this became a hobby with his father acting as mentor. He drew caricatures of schoolmates and teachers. Among his first comic characters was the "Amazing Mido" ({{lang-ar|ÙÙØ¯Ù Ø§ÙØ¹Ø¬ÙØ¨}} ''Mido al-'Ajeeb''), a young inventor who was subjected to radiation that allowed him to easily control and change his shape and form.<ref name="mawhopon">http://www.mawhopon.net/ver_ar/news.php?news_id=4832</ref><ref name="youm7">http://www.youm7.com/News.asp?NewsID=172483</ref>
According to Nady, his first published cartoon was political. The cartoon was made during the [[Gulf War]], while Nady was in elementary school, and it portrayed [[Sindbad]] hitting [[Saddam Hussein]] on the head, saying, "You've made the children of the world hate me now that they know I'm an Iraqi." In 1992, at barely 11 years of age, he won his first award in a workshop at the Mahmoud Mukhtar Museum. The following year, he was given the best caricature award by a caricature magazine.<ref name="mawhopon"/><ref name="youm7"/>
According to Nady, his first published cartoon was political. The cartoon was made during the [[Gulf War]], while Nady was in elementary school, and it portrayed [[Sindbad]] hitting [[Saddam Hussein]] on the head, saying, "You've made the children of the world hate me now that they know I'm an Iraqi." In 1992, at barely 11 years of age, he won his first award in a workshop at the Mahmoud Mukhtar Museum. The following year, he was given the best caricature award by a caricature magazine.<ref name="mawhopon"/><ref name="youm7"/>
